intro: Artanthe hostmanniana, commonly known as the hostmann's artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry and hot climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-draining soil and full sun exposure.
